string.name: title_schedule
string.translation_description: The title for the schedule screen where user can see their schedule for Google I/O.

string.name: title_home
string.translation_description: The title for the Home screen where user can all the updates from Google I/O team.

string.name: title_map
string.translation_description: The title for the map screen where user can see the map of the venue.

string.name: title_explore_io
string.translation_description: The title for the Augmented reality exploration screen where the user can explore the I/O venue in AR.

string.name: title_info
string.translation_description: The title for the info screen where user can see various information, such as FAQ and travel info.

string.name: filters
string.translation_description: The label for the button to filter sessions by their topics, room, and so on.

string.name: category_heading_tracks
string.translation_description: Label in the filters panel above session topics (Android, Cloud, etc.)

string.name: category_heading_types
string.translation_description: Label in the filters panel above event types (Sessions, Codelabs, etc.)

string.name: reset
string.translation_description: The label for the button to reset the filter conditions.

plurals.name: filter_event_count
plurals.translation_description: A label showing how many events match the current filters

string.name: search_schedule_hint
string.translation_description: Text field hint that is shown when user has not entered a search query

string.name: search_schedule_no_results
string.translation_description: Text that is shown if there are no search results

string.name: agenda
string.translation_description: The title for the agenda screen where user can see all the sessions they plan to attend.

string.name: event_starred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user adds an event to their schedule.

resources.string: Event added to your starred items

string.name: event_unstarred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user removes an event from their schedule.

string.name: event_star_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user tries to add an event.

resources.string: Error adding event to starred items

string.name: reservation_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user is trying to reserve a session attendance.

resources.string: Error making changes to reservation. Wait for previous requests to finish or try again later.

string.name: reservation_request_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user tries to reserve a seat for a session.

string.name: reservation_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation for a session.

string.name: reservation_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is confirmed by the system.

resources.string: Your seat has been reserved for \"%s\".

string.name: reservation_replaced
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has chosen to replace a reservation for another and it is confirmed by the system.

string.name: waitlist_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is added to the waitlist of a session reservation.

string.name: waitlist_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation and was waitlisted for a session.

string.name: got_it
string.translation_description: The label for dismissing a information messages.

string.name: dont_show
string.translation_description: The label for opting out of in-app notification messages.

string.name: reservation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Reservation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: reservation_denied_clash
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because they have reserved another event at that time

resources.string: Reservation denied: clash with another reservation

string.name: reservation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because of an unknown error

string.name: cancellation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Cancellation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: cancellation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because of an unknown error

string.name: schedule_filters_empty
string.translation_description: The message shown when a schedule page is empty because no events match the current filters.

string.name: reservation_reservable
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user can request to reserve a seat.

string.name: reservation_reserved
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user has reserved a seat.

string.name: reservation_waitlisted
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user is on the waitlist.

string.name: reservation_waitlist_available
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user can join the waitlist.

string.name: reservation_disabled
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user cannot request a seat.

string.name: reservation_pending
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which a reservation request is pending.

string.name: travel_airport_transfers_title
string.translation_description: Header label for airport transfers for travel

string.name: travel_what_to_bring_description
string.translation_description: Information on what to bring for the event

resources.string: Google I/O is an outdoor festival. While this is a big part of what makes I/O special, it also means there are some things to consider. Sessions will happen inside climate-controlled tents, but sunscreen, sunglasses, and an extra layer for the evening are recommended. I/O is a casual event, so keep this in mind when deciding what to wear.

string.name: travel_hotels_description
string.translation_description: Information on hotels for travel

resources.string: We have room blocks at many local hotels. The list of hotels and room availability will be updated regularly. Please use the map below to find the hotel that’s best for you. Hotel Map

string.name: travel_getting_to_mountain_view_description
string.translation_description: Information on getting to Mountain View for travel

resources.string:
Here are the three major airports in the Bay Area with international airline service:
San Francisco International Airport (SFO) ~24 miles

Oakland International Airport (OAK) ~32 miles

San Jose International Airport (SJC) ~12 miles

string.name: travel_getting_to_shoreline_description
string.translation_description: Information on getting to Shoreline Amphitheater travel

resources.string:
In an effort to reduce traffic congestion and reduce our carbon emissions, Google I/O 2019 has committed to be a “No Parking Event*.” This decision has been carefully considered and we are offering you many free options to arrive at the event without requiring a vehicle.

We will be providing more information as the event approaches.

*Accessibility parking will be available.

string.name: travel_shuttle_service_description
string.translation_description: Information on getting to Shoreline Amphitheater travel

resources.string: Free event shuttles from all Google recommended hotels will be provided for Google I/O attendees. There will also be select service from San Francisco, Millbrae BART, Mountain View Caltrain, San Jose, and Oakland. We are increasing the shuttle frequency and capacity at the Mountain View Caltrain and Millbrae Bart stations. Check back closer to the event for pick-up schedules and additional shuttle pickup locations. The Shuttle Schedule will be posted closer to the event.

string.name: travel_off_site_parking_description
string.translation_description: Information on off-site parking for travel

resources.string:
Free off-site parking will be provided at Avaya Stadium. Shuttles from Avaya will be provided to/from Google I/O.

Please indicate on your registration form if you have any ADA or special assistance requirements, and the planning team will follow up with you directly.

string.name: travel_for_public_transportation_description
string.translation_description: Information on public transportation for travel

resources.string:
We will offer prepaid public transit passes that will be available for pickup during preregistration. Public transportation to the area is accessible via:

Caltrain: Regional rail system

VTA: Light rail system servicing the South Bay

BART: Bay Area Rapid Transit

AMTRAK: Regional rail system

Public transit doesn’t go directly to Google I/O. Stay tuned for the exact transportation locations serviced by Google I/O event shuttles.

string.name: travel_biking_description
string.translation_description: Information on biking for travel

resources.string:
Complimentary bike parking will be available at Shoreline Amphitheatre in Parking Lot A. The Silicon Valley Bicycle Coalition will provide secure valet parking for your bicycle from 7am until the event ends each day.

Check Google Maps for the best bike routes and directions. There are two trails, Stevens Creek Trail and Permanente Creek Trail, that are convenient for bike riders heading to Shoreline Amphitheatre.

string.name: travel_ridesharing_description
string.translation_description: Information on ridesharing for travel

resources.string:
We will be offering partially subsidized use of Lyft Shared and Uber Pool to/from Shoreline with the code IO2019. You can redeem this code as long as your destination or pick up is Shoreline Amphitheatre.

Lyft Share: Download the Lyft app and use Lyft Shared using Code: IO2019 with a $15 credit per ride.

uberPOOL: Download the Uber app to use uberPOOL and share a ride using the Uber Voucher Link.

string.name: travel_airport_transfers_description
string.translation_description: Information on ridesharing for travel

resources.string: Airport transfers to SFO and SJC from Google I/O will be provided on the last day of the event. Airport transfers will NOT be provided on any other dates.

string.name: faq_when_and_where_description
string.translation_description: Information on when and where is Google I/O 2019 in FAQ

resources.string: The 2019 developer festival will be held from May 7 – 9 at Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California.

string.name: faq_how_can_i_stay_informed_description
string.translation_description: Information on when and where is Google I/O 2019 in FAQ

resources.string: To stay up-to-date on the latest information on Sessions, speakers, and overall activities, be sure to frequently visit the Google I/O 2019 website, the Google Developers Blog, and follow us on Twitter and Facebook. You can also follow and join the social conversation about Google I/O 2019 via the official #io19 hashtag. In addition, we\'ll be emailing important information to all registered attendees, along with check-in instructions prior to the festival.

string.name: faq_will_the_sessions_be_english_description
string.translation_description: Information on will the sessions be in English in FAQ

resources.string: Yes. This will allow our global audience to follow along.

string.name: faq_can_i_reserve_sessions_ahead_of_time_description
string.translation_description: Information on can I reserve sessions ahead of time in FAQ

resources.string: Starting in April, in-person attendees can reserve seats for Sessions in advance of the event on the I/O website and also via the I/O mobile app (note: a portion of Session seats will be exempt from reservations and available first-come, first-served onsite). Attendance at Codelabs, App Reviews, and Office Hours is on a first-come, first-served basis onsite.

string.name: faq_best_way_to_get_to_shoreline_description
string.translation_description: Information on what is the best way to get to Shoreline Amphitheater in FAQ

resources.string: Check out the Travel section for all the transportation tips you need, including shuttle information, driving and biking directions, ride sharing tips, and more!

string.name: faq_where_and_when_can_i_pick_up_badge_description
string.translation_description: Information on where and when an attendee can pick up their badge in FAQ

resources.string:
To expedite the check-in process, we\'ll begin badge pickup on Monday, May 6, at Shoreline Amphitheatre. To give you your Google I/O badge, we\'ll need to:
- Verify your photo ID. We\'re OK with government-issued licenses, passports, and other forms of identification. If you don\'t have proper identification, you won\'t be able to receive a badge and won\'t be admitted into the conference. The name on your ID needs to be an exact match of your registration profile. If you\'re an Academic attendee, please remember to bring proof of eligibility.
- Scan your registration QR code received via email. You can scan it from your phone—no need to print the email! #savetheenvironment

Please note, you may not share, give, or otherwise provide your badge to anyone. Google I/O badges aren\'t replaceable, so don\'t lose yours or you won\'t be readmitted to the conference. You must wear your Google I/O badge to gain admission to Google I/O, including the Sessions, Sandboxes, and After Hours. If requested by security, please display or provide additional identification. Google I/O badges may include your name, company or organization (if provided), and photo.

string.name: faq_want_a_front_row_seat_at_keynote_description
string.translation_description: Information on I want a front row seat at the Keynote in FAQ

resources.string: Everyone is guaranteed a seat for the Keynotes, but the best seats will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis during badge pickup beginning at 7am on May 6th. So make sure to come by early!

string.name: faq_what_should_i_wear_description
string.translation_description: Information on what should I wear at the conference

resources.string: Google I/O is an outdoor developer event, so please be comfortable and casual. There is no enforced dress code. The Bay Area can get very hot during the day and chilly in the evenings, so take this into consideration when planning your attire.

string.name: faq_onsite_food_options_description
string.translation_description: Information on onsite food options

resources.string: Good news, we like food, too! Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks on all three days of the conference. Dinner will also be available on Day 1 and 2 during the After Hours events.

string.name: faq_if_i_lose_something_onsite_description
string.translation_description: Information on if I lose something else in FAQ

resources.string: We got your back! The lost and found station will be located at the Conference Information Desk during event hours. Any items left overnight will be turned over to the Conference Security Office. One important detail: Google I/O badges are NOT replaceable, so don\'t lose yours or you won\'t be readmitted to the conference.

string.name: faq_after_dark_program_description
string.translation_description: Information on after dark program in FAQ

resources.string: These are two nights you don\'t want to miss! Attendees are invited to enjoy music, games, and more during the evening of May 8, and to an exclusive concert in the Amphitheatre on May 9. Food and drinks will be available on both nights (alcoholic beverages available for those 21 and over). Both After Hours events are hosted at Shoreline Amphitheatre, and your attendee badge is required for entrance.

string.name: faq_accessibility_needs_description
string.translation_description: Information on accessibility needs in FAQ

resources.string:
Google strives to make events open and accessible to everyone, regardless of disability or special needs. Participants with disabilities and/or special needs should provide details in the registration form and/or by emailing us at io19@google.com. This information will be kept private and will be distributed only to the individuals who need to know it to accommodate your request. Otherwise, please approach the Help Desk at Google I/O if you need assistance or have questions about accessibility during the event.

Shoreline Amphitheatre is an entirely outdoor venue. While the Keynotes will be taking place in an open-air amphitheatre, the Sessions will take place in enclosed areas. All areas of the venue are accessible for wheelchair users, and there will be a limited number of wheelchairs available on a first-come, first-served basis. Wheelchairs can be checked out at the First Aid station and returned at the end of each day. Additionally, there will be a service dog relief area.

We\'ll provide live real-time transcription (CART) for the Keynotes and Sessions. Caption text displayed on a large screen at the front of the room will be accessible to all attendees. We\'ll also use the text to provide captions for our livestream and post-event recordings.

If you need an ASL interpreter to accompany you in the Sessions at Google I/O, please let us know during registration and we\'ll be happy to provide one for you. We\'ll do our best to find a technical translator who is familiar with the domain, but please keep in mind that the interpreter probably won\'t be able to meet with the speakers beforehand.

ADA parking spaces will be available. When arriving at the venue, please follow signs for ADA parking. Please have your placard hanging from your rearview mirror and visible to parking employees at all times to expedite the parking process. Accessible parking spaces are readily available on a first-come, first-served basis and may not be reserved in advance to fairly serve all attendees.

string.name: faq_support_for_expectant_mothers_parent_description
string.translation_description: Information on accessibility needs in FAQ

resources.string:
We\'ll have expectant mother parking spaces in the ADA area.
Mothers who are nursing are welcome to attend the conference with their child. There will be four mothers\' rooms open on May 7 and 8 from 8am - 8pm and on May 9 from 8am - 4pm. Sign up sheets will be available in front of the mothers\' rooms and usage is first-come, first-served. Please see the conference help desk for more information.

Childcare reimbursement of USD $100 per day (not exceeding USD $300 total) will be offered to parents attending that express interest in childcare via our registration form, and is available on a first-come, first-served basis. Our childcare reimbursement is offered through a third-party vendor. If your request for childcare is approved by us via email before the conference starts and your onsite attendance is confirmed, our vendor will reach out to you with next steps within 7 business days following Google I/O. They will manage all disbursement of our childcare disbursement.

string.name: faq_community_guidelines_and_policy_description
string.translation_description: Information on guidelines and Anti harassment policy in FAQ

resources.string:
Google is dedicated to providing a harassment-free and inclusive event experience for everyone regardless of gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disabilities, neurodiversity, physical appearance, body size, ethnicity, nationality, race, age, religion, or other protected category. In an effort to make the event as inclusive as possible, gender-neutral bathrooms will be offered throughout the venue.

We don\'t tolerate harassment of event participants in any form.
Google takes violations of our policy seriously and will respond appropriately. For more information on Google\'s Event Community Guidelines and Anti-Harassment Policy, please see here.

string.name: faq_sessions_be_live_streamed_question_description
string.translation_description: Information on whether the sessions be livestreamd in FAQ

resources.string: The two Keynotes and all Sessions will be livestreamed on the event website\'s homepage during the three days of the festival. If you\'re busy at work or on the other side of the planet with a tricky time difference, you can watch the session recordings later on the Google Developers YouTube channel.

string.name: faq_want_to_celebrate_i_o_description
string.translation_description: Information on I want to celebrate I/O with my community in FAQ

resources.string:
Yes! Every year, developers around the world host Google I/O Extended events. During these events, organizers can livestream the event and host their own sessions including hackathons, codelabs, demos, and more.
If you\'re joining us as an I/O Extended host this year, here are the steps you should take to get started:

Read through the Organizer Guide to get tips and suggestions on how to host a successful event.

Register your public event on the I/O website for increased visibility.

Use the official #io19extended hashtag on all your social posts related to I/O Extended for easier discoverability.

Note: I/O Extended hosts can request the deletion of their personal and/or event data after the event ends by emailing io19@google.com.
If you simply want to attend an I/O Extended event, browse our map to find one near you and RSVP!
For questions about the I/O Extended program, contact us at io19extended\-external@google.com.

string.name: view_sessions_text
string.translation_description: Link label for viewing all sessions in schedule.

string.name: wifi_install_success
string.translation_description: Snackbar message when wifi network is successfully saved.

string.name: wifi_install_clipboard_message

resources.string: Unable to save wifi network.\nSaved password to clipboard instead.

string.name: event_sessions_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "sessions".

string.name: event_sandbox_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general "sandbox" description.

string.name: event_codelabs_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "codelabs".

string.name: event_officehours_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "office hours and app reviews".

string.name: event_afterhours_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "after hours"

string.name: event_meals_title
string.translation_description: Header label for general information on "meals"

string.name: event_sessions_description
string.translation_description: General information on sessions

resources.string: Starting in April, in-person attendees can reserve seats for Sessions in advance of the event on the I/O website and also via the I/O mobile app (note: a portion of Session seats will be exempt from reservations and available first-come, first-served onsite). Attendance at Codelabs, App Reviews, and Office Hours is on a first-come, first-served basis onsite.

string.name: event_sandbox_description
string.translation_description: General information on sandboxes.

resources.string: Dedicated spaces to explore, learn, and play with our latest products and platforms via interactive demos, physical installations, and more.

string.name: event_codelabs_description
string.translation_description: General information on codelabs.

resources.string: Get hands-on experience in our ready-to-code kiosks. Here, you’ll have everything you need to learn about the latest and greatest Google technologies via self-paced tutorials, or bring your own machine and take your work home with you. Google staff will be on hand for helpful advice and to provide direction if you get stuck.

string.name: event_officehours_description
string.translation_description: General information on office hours and app reviews.

resources.string: Office Hours are your chance to meet one-on-one with Google experts to ask all your technical questions, and App Reviews will give you the opportunity to receive advice and tips on your specific app-related projects.

string.name: event_afterhours_description
string.translation_description: General information on after hours.

resources.string: After Sessions end for the day, stick around Shoreline for two evenings of food, drinks, and fun. On the first night, the party will take over the Sandbox space, and on the second night, we\'ll have an exclusive concert in the Amphitheatre.

string.name: event_meals_description
string.translation_description: General information on meals.

resources.string: Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks on all three days of the conference. Dinner will also be available on Day 1 and 2 during the After Hours events.

resources.string: Just say \"Hey Google, talk to Google I/O 19\"!

string.name: no_network_description
string.translation_description: Message to be shown when user tries to open the Explore feature without any network connection. [CHAR_LIMIT=500]

resources.string:
To use Explore I/O, try:

 - Turning off airplane mode

 - Turning on mobile data or Wi-Fi

 - Checking the signal in your area

resources.string: Try another device, or borrow one from a friend

string.name: codelabs_information
string.translation_description: Information about codelabs.

resources.string: Learn about the latest and greatest Google technologies via self-paced tutorials in our ready-to-code kiosks, or bring your own machine and take your work home with you. Kiosks are open daily except during the first Keynote.
